trans-unit.source: Provides text for a <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextView"></xref> object.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The TextViewElement class supports the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextView> by breaking the text property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextView> object into logical elements.
Each element is then used by the pagination mechanism of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextView> object.

It is this class that the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextView> mobile control uses to ensure that page breaks do not occur in the midst of links or other elements that should not be divided between pages.
If you want to derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextView> mobile control or are creating a new adapter, you will likely be able to use this class without modification.
Sets or returns a property that determines whether an additional trailing break is rendered after the control.
This break causes subsequent content to start on the next line.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This property is ignored by controls for which a trailing break is not appropriate.
The following table lists the controls that support the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.BreakAfter%2A> property for certain kinds of devices.

|Control|Device With HTML Browser|Device With WML Browser|Device with WML/UP Browser| |-------------|------------------------------|-----------------------------|---------------------------------| |AdRotator|||| |Calendar|Y||| |Command|Y|Y|| |Image|Y|Y|Y| |Label|Y|Y|Y| |Link|Y|Y|| |List|||| |ObjectList|Y (unless device's browser can handle tables)||| |Panel (default is false)|Y|Y|Y| |PhoneCall|Y|Y|| |SelectionList|Y (Unless browser can handle tables)|Y|| |TextBox|Y|Y|| |TextView|Y|Y|| |TextViewElement|Y|Y|| |Validator|Y|Y|Y|
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if an additional trailing break is rendered after the control; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the text is bold.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if text is bold; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the text is italic.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if text is italic; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Sets or returns the text for the control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The Text property can be specified by using the `Text` attribute, or as inner text.
If the Text property is specified in both ways, the inner text always takes precedence.
However, if the Text property is programmatically set, the inner text is automatically removed and the newly set property takes precedence.
The text for the control.
Returns the URL of the text.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The URL of the text.
